name: Tal Linzen
content: Tal Linzen Tal Linzen Home Research Teaching CV I am an Associate Professor of Linguistics and Data Science at New York University, and a Research Scientist at Google. At NYU, I direct the Computation and Psycholinguistics Lab; we use behavioral experiments and computational methods to study how people learn and understand language. At both Google and NYU, I also work on large language model post-training, evaluation and interpretability. For inquiries related to DS-GA 1012, Large Language Models: Evaluation and Applications, please start here. I am accepting PhD students for Fall 2026 through either Linguistics or Data Science; I look forward to reading your applications! Please read the FAQ before contacting me about PhD admissions. I am currently hiring one or more post-docs to work on projects related to cognitively plausible LLMs, through interpretability, training data, and modeling. Please reach out if interested!
